1.name: Voter Interface
1.description: Web-based interface where voters access ballots and submit votes. Handles authentication and ballot presentation.
exploitation: Inject malicious script into ballot questions
ethicalConsiderations: Voters trust the interface to protect their privacy
XSS attacks could expose personal voting preferences
Session vulnerabilities could enable vote selling

2.name: Vote Processing Engine
2.description: Core system that validates, processes, and aggregates votes before blockchain commitment. Critical for election integrity.
vulnerabilities: SQL injection in vote validation queries
Race condition in vote counting logic
exploitation: Inject SQL to manipulate vote records
Exploit race conditions to double-count votes
Execute arbitrary code via malicious vote payloads
Bypass signature checks to submit fraudulent votes
Crash the system during peak voting hours
ethicalConsiderations: This system is the foundation of democratic participation
Exploiting it could undermine election legitimacy
Vulnerabilities here affect millions of voters
Disclosure timing is critical for election security

3.name: Blockchain Network
3.description: Decentralized ledger that stores immutable vote records and enables public verification of election results.
vulnerabilities: Integer overflow in vote tallying contract
Reentrancy attack in vote commitment function
Gas limit DoS in result aggregation
Private key exposure in deployment scripts
exploitation: Overflow vote counts to manipulate totals
Block vote processing with gas exhaustion
Access admin functions with leaked keys
ethicalConsiderations: Smart contract bugs can't be easily fixed
Public verification relies on system integrity
Exploits here affect long-term trust in digital voting
